FSC.ApplyPredefinedText: This will overwrite the configuration for the calendar ${CAL_NAME} to match the selected predefined calendar. These changes will only be applied if the configuration is saved. Are you sure?
FSC.Configuration.AddCalendar.CalendarNa: A name for your new calendar to help distinguish it from the other calendars.
FSC.Configuration.Client.Title: Client Settings
FSC.Configuration.Client.Description: These are settings that only affect how Simple Calendar works or is displayed for this browser. They do not affect any other players. These settings can also be found under the module settings.
FSC.Configuration.Client.OpenOnLoad.Desc: Will open up the Simple Calendar application when Foundry VTT is loaded.
FSC.Configuration.Client.OpenCompact.Des: When the Simple Calendar application is opened it will open in the compact view by default.
FSC.Configuration.Client.RememberPositio: Simple Calendar will remember where it was last positioned and place itself there.
FSC.Configuration.Client.RememberCompact: Simple Calendar will remember where the compact version was last positioned and place itself there when in compact mode. This is a separate position from the full version.
FSC.Configuration.Client.NoteReminderNot: How Simple Calendar will send reminder notifications for notes.
Send a chat whisper with details about the note.
FSC.Configuration.Client.NoteListOpenDir: The direction from the main calendar that the side drawers will open. The side drawers contain the calendar list, note list and note search.
FSC.Configuration.Client.AlwaysShowNoteL: This setting will make it so the note list will always be visible and can not be closed. The only exception is if the calendar list or note search are opened they will open over top of the note list, but when closed the note list will remain visible.
When enabled this setting will remove the close button from the calendar window and prevent the escape key from closing it. The button under Journal Notes in the left toolbar then becomes a toggle to open and close the calendar.
FSC.Configuration.Client.CompactViewScal: This setting lets you change the scale at which the compact view is displayed at. You can use this to make the compact view appear larger or smaller. The number represents the percentage of the scale size when compared to the default size, 100%.
FSC.Configuration.CombatPauseRule.Title: Pause Real Time Clock on Combat Rule
FSC.Configuration.CombatPauseRule.Descri: Choose when the real time clock will be paused when combats are running on scenes.
FSC.Configuration.CombatPauseRule.Active: Pause Only on the Active Scene
FSC.Configuration.CombatPauseRule.Curren: Pause on the Scene the GM is Currently Viewing
FSC.Configuration.Display.Description: These settings allow you to change how the date and time are displayed for the selected calendar. For more details about configuring date formats please check out the documentation or expand the table below.
FSC.Configuration.Display.CompactControl: Choose the layout for the buttons used to change the date/time of the calendar while in compact view.
FSC.Configuration.General.CalendarNameHe: The name of the calendar to help distinguish it from other calendars.
FSC.Configuration.General.Description: These settings allow you to configure more general options for the selected calendar.
FSC.Configuration.General.PlayersChangeA: The checked roles will be able to change which calendar is currently active.
FSC.Configuration.Global.Title: Global Configuration
FSC.Configuration.Global.Description: These settings will affect how Simple Calendar works for every calendar as opposed to how a specific calendar will work.
FSC.Configuration.Global.SameTimestamp.D: This is an advanced option, read the documentation for a more detailed explanation. This option will force all the calendars to use the same timestamp. This means that when switching calendars any active effects will not expire as the game world time will be the same. This does mean that you won't be able to specify the individual dates of each calendar as they will map to what ever date/time the timestamp is for.
FSC.Configuration.Global.SyncCalendars.D: When checked this option will cause all calendars to change their date/time when using the controls to change the date/time forward or backwards.
Whether to show the note folder in the Journal Entries tab. This requires a refresh to take effect.
FSC.Configuration.ImportExport.ExportDes: Choose which settings and calendar settings to be exported out. These exports can be shared and imported into other worlds.
FSC.Configuration.ImportExport.ImportDes: Choose an exported file that contains configuration settings for Simple Calendar to import into this world.
FSC.Configuration.ImportExport.ImportDet: These configuration settings have been found in the selected file. Choose which settings to apply and to which Calendar to apply them to.
FSC.Configuration.Month.Description: These settings allow you to add and remove months to the selected calendar as well as customize those months. Important to note that a calendar must always have at least 1 month.
FSC.Configuration.Notes.PostNoteReminder: When a user first logs into Foundry VTT any note reminders on the current day will be whispered to them.
FSC.Configuration.QuickSetup.Description: Follow these directions below to quickly get a calendar set up and running!
FSC.Configuration.QuickSetup.ChooseCurre: Set the initial Year, Month and Day for your calendar.
FSC.Configuration.QuickSetup.ChoosePrede: Choose one of these predefined calendars to base this current calendar on. This will change the current calendar's settings to match the selected predefined calendar's settings.
FSC.Configuration.QuickSetup.ImportNotes: If to add any notes that come along with the predefined calendar. These are usually calendar specific holidays.
FSC.Configuration.Theme.Title: Theme
FSC.Configuration.Theme.Description: Choose the visual theme to apply to the Simple Calendar module to change how it looks.
FSC.Configuration.Title: Simple Calendar Configuration
FSC.Configuration.Season.Title: Season Settings
FSC.Migration.Title: Migration
FSC.Migration.v1v2.Title: Migration From Simple Calendar v1 to v2
FSC.Migration.v1v2.Help:
Welcome to Simple Calendar version 2!

For the full list of improvements check out the change log!

Part of the improvements required changes to how Simple Calendar stores data, but don't worry Simple Calendar is all ready moving your data over to the new format!
FSC.Migration.v1v2.Calendar: Migrating calendar data to the new version!
FSC.Migration.v1v2.GlobalConfiguration: Migrating global configuration data to the new version!
FSC.Migration.v1v2.CleanupSuccess: Old Simple Calendar data has been successfully cleaned up!
FSC.Migration.v1v2.CleanupFail: There was an error cleaning up old Simple Calendar data. You can continue to use the new version but the old data may not have all been removed.
FSC.Migration.APIDialog.Title: Run Migration?
FSC.Migration.APIDialog.Content: This will force the running of Simple Calendar's migration tool. Are you sure you want to run the migration?
FSC.Notes.UserPermissionHelp: Choose which players will be able to view this note.
FSC.RemoveCalendarConfirmText: This will permanently remove the calendar ${CAL_NAME}. Are you sure?
FSC.Search.Options.Title: Search Options
FSC.Search.Options.Fields.Title: Title
FSC.ViewingDifferentCalendar: Some controls have been hidden because this is not the active calendar.
FSC.Title: Simple Calendar
FSC.DateFormat.Title: Format Tokens
FSC.DateFormat.Description: A list of the different formatting tokens to use in the format settings below.
FSC.DateFormat.Year.Name: Year name, as determined by the year name settings.
FSC.DateFormat.Year.Prefix: Year prefix as defined in the Year Prefix setting.
FSC.DateFormat.Year.Postfix: Year postfix as defined in the Year Postfix setting.
FSC.DateFormat.Month.NumberPadded: Months number padded with a zero.
FSC.DateFormat.Month.AbbreviatedName: The month's abbreviated name as defined in the month's settings.
FSC.DateFormat.Month.Name: The month's full name as defined in the month's settings.
FSC.DateFormat.Day.NumberPadded: Days number padded with a zero.
FSC.DateFormat.Day.NumberSuffix: Day number appended with its suffix.
FSC.DateFormat.Weekday.Number: The number for the day of the week.
FSC.DateFormat.Weekday.NumberPadded: The number for the day of the week padded with a zero.
FSC.DateFormat.Weekday.AbbreviatedName: The abbreviated name for the day of the week.
FSC.DateFormat.Weekday.Name: The full name for the day of the week.
FSC.DateFormat.Hour.12Hour: The hours number in the 12 hour format.
FSC.DateFormat.Hour.24Hour: The hours number in the 24 hour format.
FSC.DateFormat.Hour.12HourPadded: The hours number padded with a zero in the 12 hour format.
FSC.DateFormat.Hour.24HourPadded: The hours number padded with a zero in the 24 hour format.
FSC.DateFormat.Hour.ampm: The am/pm indicator for the 12 hour time format in lowercase.
FSC.DateFormat.Hour.AMPM: The AM/PM indicator for the 12 hour time format in uppercase.
FSC.DateFormat.Minute.NumberPadded: The minutes number padded with a zero.
FSC.DateFormat.Second.NumberPadded: The seconds number padded with a zero.
FSC.DateFormat.TextDescription: For any text that should be in the format but not processed place square brackets around it.
FSC.SetCurrentDateDialog.Title: Confirm Current Date Change
FSC.SetCurrentDateDialog.Content:
You have selected to change the date to a day which is not currently visible!
Are you sure you want to change the current date to {DATE}?
FSC.Search.Title: Search
FSC.DeleteConfirmText: Do you really want to delete this note?
FSC.NoteDirtyText: There are unsaved changes for this note, close anyway? Changes will be lost.
FSC.Notes.ReminderHelp: You will be reminded of this event.
FSC.Notes.RepeatingHelp: If this note repeats weekly, monthly, yearly or not at all.
FSC.Notes.DateTime.Title: Note Date/Time
FSC.Notes.DateTime.Help: The date of the note and optionally the time of day the note occurs.
FSC.Notes.Author: Author
FSC.Notes.MacroHelp: Select a macro that will be automatically executed when the date and time of the note passes.
FSC.Configuration.General.Title: General Settings
FSC.Configuration.General.GameWorldTimeH: Tell Simple Calendar how to integrate itself with the game world time and respond to game world time updates.
FSC.Configuration.General.None: None: Does not tie into the game world time.
FSC.Configuration.General.Self: Self: Control the game world time ignoring updates from other modules.
FSC.Configuration.General.ThirdParty: Third Party Module: Only follows game world time updates from other modules.
FSC.Configuration.General.Mixed: Mixed: Update the game world time and follow updates made from other modules.
FSC.Configuration.General.PF2ESyncHelp: This will force Simple Calendar to stay in sync with the built in Pathfinder 2E world time.
FSC.Configuration.General.PF2ESyncDisabl: This setting has been disabled because the calendar general setting 'Pathfinder 2E: World Time Sync' is enabled.
FSC.Configuration.General.ShowClockHelp: Whether to show the clock below the calendar, also displays the controls for changing hours, minutes, and seconds.
FSC.Configuration.General.PlayerAddNotes: The checked roles will be able to add notes to the calendar.
FSC.Configuration.General.PlayerReorderN: The checked roles will be able to re-order notes on a day.
FSC.Configuration.General.Permissions.No: Here the permissions for various interactions with Simple Calendar can be adjusted based on Foundry roles. Game masters will always have these permissions.
FSC.Configuration.General.CalendarPlayer: The checked roles will be able to open Simple Calendar.
FSC.Configuration.General.PlayersChangeD: The checked roles will be able to change the date and time of Simple Calendar
FSC.Configuration.General.Display.DateFo: The format text used to put together the display text for a date.
The format text used to put together the display text for a time.
The format text used to put together the display text for just the month and year that appears at the top of the calendar view.
FSC.Configuration.Notes.Title: Note Settings
FSC.Configuration.NoteCategories.Name: Note Category Name
FSC.Configuration.NoteCategories.NameHel: The display name of this note category.
FSC.Configuration.NoteCategories.ColorHe: The color associated with the note category.
FSC.Configuration.Notes.NoteCategoriesHe: Select all of the different note categories associated with this note.
FSC.Configuration.Year.Title: Year Settings
FSC.Configuration.Year.CurrentHelp: The current year that the game is taking place in. This can also be changed with the Date Controls.
FSC.Configuration.Year.PrefixHelp: Text that appears before the year number.
FSC.Configuration.Year.PostfixHelp: Text that appears after the year number.
FSC.Configuration.Year.YearZeroHelp: This is the year that is considered to be year zero for calculating how much time has passed. This will generally not need to be changed.
FSC.Configuration.Year.YearNameHelp: The text name to be used when naming years.
FSC.Configuration.Year.YearNamesStartHel: The year that the year name list starts from.
FSC.Configuration.Year.YearNameBehaviour: How to determine the order of year names.
FSC.Configuration.Season.Name: Season Name
FSC.Configuration.Season.StartingDateHel: The month and day when this season starts every year.
FSC.Configuration.Season.ColorHelp: The color to associate with this season.
FSC.Configuration.Season.IconHelp: The icon to associate with this season.
FSC.Configuration.Season.SunriseSunsetHe: The time of day the sun rises and sun sets for the first day of the season.
FSC.Configuration.Season.DescriptionHelp: A description about the season to give more flavour to your calendar. This information is visible when a user clicks on the name of the season in the main calendar view.
FSC.Configuration.Month.Title: Month Settings
FSC.Configuration.Month.Name: Month Name
FSC.Configuration.Month.NameHelp: The text name of this month.
FSC.Configuration.Month.DaysHelp: The number of days that make up this month.
FSC.Configuration.Month.IntercalaryHelp: If this month is to be considered an intercalary month or not.
FSC.Configuration.Month.AbbreviationHelp: The abbreviated text name of this month.
FSC.Configuration.Month.DescriptionHelp: A description about the month to give more flavour to your calendar. This information is visible when a user clicks on the name of the month in the main calendar view.
FSC.Configuration.Month.IntercalaryInclu: Include Intercalary Month in Day Calculations
If checked the intercalary month will be treated like a normal month for calculating the day of the week days fall on and the total days in a year but still be listed as an intercalary month.
FSC.Configuration.Month.DayOffsetHelp: The amount to offset the day's number by. Used if you want to start a month at 2 instead of 1.
FSC.Configuration.Month.NumberHelp: The numeric representation of this month.
FSC.Configuration.Month.StartingWeekDayH: Choose which day of the week this month will always start on, or leave as default to let the calendar figure out the appropriate weekday.
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.Title: Weekday Settings
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.ShowHeadingsHe: If to show the weekday headings on the calendar.
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.Name: Weekday Name
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.NameHelp: The text name of this day of the week.
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.AbbreviationHe: The abbreviated text name of this day of the week.
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.WeekendHelp: The part of the week that is traditionally devoted to rest, rather than work. eg. The weekend in the modern Gregorian calendar
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.DescriptionHel: A description about the weekday to give more flavour to your calendar. This information is visible when a user clicks on the name of a weekday in the main calendar view.
FSC.Configuration.Weekday.FirstWeekDayHe: This sets the day of the week that the first day of year 0 starts on.
FSC.Configuration.DefaultNoteVisibilityH: For new notes, if by default the player visibility option is checked or not.
FSC.Configuration.LeapYear.Title: Leap Year Settings
FSC.Configuration.LeapYear.RuleHelp: The rules to follow when determining leap years.
FSC.Configuration.LeapYear.CustomModHelp: Every x number of years is a leap year.
FSC.Configuration.LeapYear.Days: Number of Days in a Leap Year
FSC.Configuration.LeapYear.DaysHelp: The number of days that make up this month during a leap year.
FSC.Configuration.Time.Title: Time Settings
FSC.Configuration.Time.HoursInDayHelp: How many hours make up a single day.
FSC.Configuration.Time.MinutesInHourHelp: How many minutes make up a single hour.
FSC.Configuration.Time.SecondsInMinuteHe: How many seconds make up a single minute.
FSC.Configuration.Time.SecondsInCombatRo: How many seconds pass during 1 round of combat. This is only applied if the current system does not increment time during combat rounds!
FSC.Configuration.Time.GameTimeRatio: Game Seconds Per Real Life Seconds
FSC.Configuration.Time.GameTimeRatioHelp: How many seconds pass in game for every second that passes in real time.
FSC.Configuration.Time.UpdateFrequencyHe: This determines how often the clock updates.
FSC.Configuration.Time.UnifyGameAndClock: Unify Clock Start/Pause With Game Pause
Ties the clocks start/pause button with the games pause/unpause option.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.Title: Moon Settings
FSC.Configuration.Moon.Name: Moon Name
FSC.Configuration.Moon.CycleLengthHelp: The length of the lunar cycle in days. Accepts decimals.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.CycleAdjustmentHe: The amount of days to adjust the calculation by when determining the current phase.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.ColorHelp: The color to associate with this moon.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.PhaseNameHelp: The name of this phase of the moon.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.PhaseLengthHelp: How long the phase lasts in days.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.PhaseSingleDayHel: If this moon phase should only happen on 1 day.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.PhaseIconHelp: The icon to associate with this moon phase.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.YearResetHelp: If the year for the reference moon should reset and if so when it does.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.YearResetLeap: Reset reference year every leap year
FSC.Configuration.Moon.YearResetX: Reset reference year every X years
FSC.Configuration.Moon.YearXHelp: Reset the reference new moons year every x number of years.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.YearHelp: The year of a new moon to use as a reference.
FSC.Configuration.Moon.MonthHelp: The month and day of a new moon to use as a reference.
FSC.Info.ThemeChange: Simple Calendar's theme has been changed by a system/module/macro to "{THEME}". The theme can be changed back under Simple Calendar's settings.
FSC.Warn.Time.ActiveCombats: There is an active combat/combats running, please resolve them before starting the real time clock.
FSC.Warn.Macros.GMUpdate: Only the GM can update the calendar date!
FSC.Warn.Calendar.NotGM: There is no GM present in the game, a GM needs to be logged in for players to change the date/time.
FSC.Error.Calendar.GMCurrent: You need to be a GM to change the current date.
